result.execSummary:
The defendant Taylor R Zacharias was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Taylor R Zacharias is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Taylor R Zacharias was found guilty of Operate with Restricted Controlled Substance (1st w/ Minor Pass < 16 yrs.), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(am).
  • Taylor R Zacharias was found guilty of Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
3:27 p.m..  Defendant in court with Atty Jon Wilsnack.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  DA recites agreement.  Atty Wilsnack concurs.  Defendant concurs.

Court questions defendant.  Defendant enter No Contest plea to count 1 and count 2.  Court goes over plea questionnaire with the defendant.  Court goes over constitutional rights with the defendant - defendant waives these rights.  Court goes over the elements of each offense.  Court instructs defendant of the maximum penalty.  Court instructs defendant regarding deportation.

Court finds the plea is made freely, voluntarily, intelligently and understandingly.  Court finds there is a factual basis to support the plea.  Court finds defendant guilty to counts 1 and 2.  Court orders the judgment of conviction be entered here today.  DA requests count 3 and 15TR821 be dismissed.  Court so orders.  Sentencing statement by Atty Wilsnack.  Requests defendant's jail sentence be with Huber, served in FDL Co. and served on 2 day increments when he has days off at work.  Statement by the defendant.

Court sentences the defendant to:

Count 1

-  $350 fine plus court costs.  Court grants the defendant 60 days to pay or payment plan.  Pay $50/month, commencing July 1st and by the 1st of each month thereafter.
-  12 month DL revocation.
-  AODA assessment.
-  5 days in Green Lake County Jail,  Court grants defendant 60 days to report - with Huber.  Defendant can transfer to FDL County if permitted per Green Lake and FDL policy.  Court does permit defendant to serve in 2 day increments if approved by the jail.

Count 2

-  Court costs only

-  Defendant is to submit a DNA Sample.

-  Defendant to pay $200 DNA surcharge.

Court adjourned at 3:37 p.m.
from Judge Bult to Atty Jon Wilsnack dated June 2, 2016
